info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 8:45AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...STORMY START TO THE NEW YEAR... Will see a return to more active weather later this weekend. Strong westerly flow over the Pacific will bring rather wet and breezy fronts to the region, with the first one arriving on Sunday, followed by others through next week. Rain may be heavy at times on Sunday into Sunday night, and again at times through next week. Snow levels will start at 1500 to 2000 feet on Sunday, and rise slowly to 3000 feet Monday. Expect heavy snow for the Cascades, with 1 to 2 feet of snow likely during that time, with another foot of snow likely through Tuesday. In addition, breezy winds may create white-out conditions at times, with challenging travel conditions for Sunday night through Tuesday. Snow levels will gradually rise next week, up to 5000 feet or higher on Wednesday and Thursday. With return of rain falling onto the snow, backcountry enthusiasts may see an increasing avalanche potential later next week.
